author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Skip Barber Racing School Enhances Driver Training with SimCraft
text:
Skip Barber Racing School Enhances Driver Training with SimCraft
Skip Barber Racing School has partnered with SimCraft, enhancing its driver training capabilities with the installation of 10 state-of-the-art motion simulators at its Long Island, N.Y. headquarters. This collaboration aims to provide students and professional drivers with advanced tools for skill development, including race line refinement and braking technique practice. By offering a high-tech training environment, Skip Barber is positioned to better prepare drivers for real-world racing challenges. With its location near major airports, the school now ensures easy access for participants traveling nationwide, facilitating seamless training sessions. CEO Anthony DeMonte emphasizes this partnership as a pivotal enhancement to their existing programs.
By the Numbers- 10 SimCraft motion simulators installed at Skip Barber Racing School.
- Located a short drive from three major U.S. airports: MacArthur, LaGuardia, and JFK.
While the simulators offer a significant technological upgrade, some purists argue that real-life driving experiences are irreplaceable for mastering racing techniques.
State of Play- Simulators enhance training efforts for both novice and professional drivers.
- The partnership reflects Skip Barber's ongoing commitment to cutting-edge driver education.
As the partnership rolls out, it's expected that more racing schools may follow suit, adopting similar technologies to enhance driver training programs, potentially reshaping how racing skills are developed.
Bottom LineThe collaboration between Skip Barber Racing School and SimCraft marks a transformative step in racing education, aligning traditional training methods with innovative technology to better prepare drivers for competitive success.
Read more at RACER
The summary of the linked article was generated with the assistance of artificial intelligence technology from OpenAI

author: TNN
title: Heatwave: Season’s First 40°c Day | Ahmedabad News - Times of India
text: Ahmedabad: Due to a heatwave on Thursday, the mercury touched 40°C in Amreli and Rajkot for the first time this season. Ahmedabad recorded a maximum temperature of 37.4°C, 0.7 degrees higher than normal. The minimum temperature at 22°C was 1.6 degrees higher than normal.According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast, minimum and maximum temperatures will likely stay around 38°C and 22°C on Friday. “No large change during the next five days is very likely,” mentioned the forecast.At 40.2°C, Amreli recorded the highest maximum temperature, followed by 40.1°C in Rajkot and 39.4°C in Keshod. Parts of north Gujarat reported cloudy weather. tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyDelhi records minimum temperature of 10.1 degree Celsius, IMD predicts partly cloudy sky todayDelhi experienced a chilly morning with 10.1C min temp and 30C max. Humidity at 70%, AQI 147 'moderate'. Ranges: 0-50 'good', 51-100 'satisfactory'. Cloudy skies, pollution levels categorized.Delhi records minimum temperature of 11.9 degree Celsius, IMD predicts cloudy skies todayDelhi's morning chill at 11.9C below usual, cloudy skies, 67% humidity. AQI 'moderate' at 185. Sunday, 8:30 am recorded.Winter temperature trends in India hint at shorter spring, study showsClimate Central study reveals India's winter temperature surge, impacting spring duration. Urgent actions needed to combat climate change effects on ecosystems and livelihoods.

author: Westport Fuel Systems Inc.
title: Volvo Group and Westport Celebrate Transformative Partnership | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Event Highlights Joint Venture’s Role in Global Adoption of HPDI™ Fuel System,
Advancing Commercial Transportation to Smarter, Cleaner Power with IC Engines
VANCOUVER, British Columbia, July 05, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Volvo Group (“Volvo”) and Westport Fuel Systems Inc. ("Westport" or the “Company”) (TSX: WPRT / Nasdaq: WPRT ) today marked a defining moment in the journey of the newly formed joint venture (JV) as the two companies celebrated the official launch of their partnership with an exclusive event at the University of British Columbia, the birthplace of Westport's HPDI™ fuel system technology.
Nurtured for nearly 30 years within Westport, the two partners are coming together to jointly promote, develop and further accelerate the commercialization of the HPDI technology. In doing so, the JV will resolutely focus on moving forward affordable, sustainable transportation solutions using the internal combustion engine operating on renewable fuels now and hydrogen in the future.
“This joint venture is poised to make a significant impact on global long-haul and off-road heavy-duty applications,” said Dan Sceli, Chief Executive Officer and Director of Westport Fuel Systems, and interim President of the Volvo/Westport JV. “By combining Volvo’s extensive expertise in commercial vehicle and power system manufacturing with Westport’s innovative fuel system technology, we are creating a powerful force for change that can make a meaningful contribution to reduce carbon emissions immediately and affordably. Together we are committed to delivering sustainable, efficient, and economically viable solutions for long-haul transportation.”
Partnership is the New Leadership
Leaders from both companies joined-in on the celebration of this milestone, emphasizing the significance of the partnership in driving forward HPDI’s breakthrough technology in tackling the urgent challenges of climate change.
“Today is a day of celebration as we join together to collectively advance this critically important clean transportation initiative,” said Lars Stenqvist, Chief Technology Officer of Volvo Group. “We believe HPDI-powered internal combustion engines, running on hydrogen and renewable fuels, play a crucial role in global decarbonization efforts in commercial transportation. The joint venture enables us to combine this innovative fuel system with our strategic expertise to guide OEMs and fleets as they navigate the energy transition.”
“This is a momentous occasion for Westport and the HPDI technology. The alliance between our two companies affirms our steadfast commitment to drive decarbonization in the heavy-duty sector utilizing alternative fuels while still providing the efficiency, power and durability that comes with diesel cycle engines,” said Scott Baker, Vice President, Product Development and Technology Officer of the Volvo/Westport JV.
Baker continued, “Together, we will provide unparalleled expertise and counsel to customers around the globe on optimizing their existing CO 2 reduction strategies, ultimately paving the way for a more sustainable future in heavy-duty transportation.”
Collaboration with transportation partners and end-users has led to the deployment of the HPDI system in thousands of Volvo trucks across Europe, underscoring its effectiveness in achieving carbon neutrality. Since the commercial release of HPDI in 2018, fleets have collectively avoided hundreds of thousands of tons of CO 2 emissions annually. This success demonstrates the immediate impact of integrating hydrogen and biogas technologies into existing infrastructure.
At the heart of the HPDI ™ Fuel System is a revolutionary patented injector with a dual concentric needle design that delivers small quantities of diesel fuel and large quantities of natural gas, at high pressure, to the combustion chamber. The natural gas is injected at the end of the compression stroke. Launched in 2024, the Volvo FH Aero gas-powered is a long-haul truck shaped for aerodynamic efficiency.
IMAGE: VOLVO TRUCKS
About Westport Fuel Systems
At Westport, we are driving innovation to power a cleaner tomorrow. We are a leading supplier of advanced fuel delivery components and systems for clean, low-carbon fuels such as natural gas, renewable natural gas, propane, and hydrogen to the global transportation industry. Our technology delivers the performance and fuel efficiency required by transportation applications and the environmental benefits that address climate change and urban air quality challenges. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, with operations in Europe, Asia, North America, and South America, we serve our customers in more than 70 countries with leading global transportation brands. At Westport, we think ahead. For more information, visit www.wfsinc.com .
Contact
Westport Media Relations
T: 1 604-718-1992
E: media@wfsinc.com
A photo accompanying this announcement is available at https://www.globenewswire.com/NewsRoom/AttachmentNg/df85fab7-ce58-479f-a699-5538feae8e5c

author: (lavozdigital)
title: Cádiz enaltece su Corpus
text:
Corpus Christi 2024
Cádiz enaltece su Corpus
Jesús Sacramentado recorre las calles para hacerse presente entre los gaditanos en este día de la Caridad
El viento de levante no ha defraudado y ha acompañado este domingo de Corpus en Cádiz que se ha iniciado con los últimos traslados y preparativos muy temprano, a primera hora de la mañana. En la Catedral de Cádiz todo estaba dispuesto en este día de la Caridad, en este año de la Eucaristía declarado por el obispo Rafael Zornoza. Llegaban los fieles y lo hacían también las distintas autoridades, además de la corporación municipal, que acudía bajo mazas a la Seo y acompañada por la banda de música Maestro Dueñas de El Puerto. Cofrades de las hermandades de la ciudad y asociaciones religiosas también han estado presentes la misa.
Sonaban las campanas de la Catedral y minutos más tarde de la hora prevista comenzaba el Solemne Pontifical con la entrada al templo desde la sacristía del obispo, Rafael Zornoza, y los demás sacerdotes que le han acompañado en la celebración.
La espléndida Custodia gaditana lucía en la Catedral exornada con rosas rojas. Allí también se encontraba la Virgen del Rosario, Patrona de Cádiz con distintas flores en tonos rosas y blanco. Además estaban sobre sus andas preparados para la procesión las imágenes del beato Diego José de Cádiz, el Niño Jesús de Santo Domingo y los santos patronos San Servando y San Germán.
En su homilía Rafael Zornoza incidía en la importancia de esta festividad. «Estamos aquí para celebrar esta fiesta con gozo. Es una fiesta que nos obliga a saborear mejor las verdades de la fe y la redencion del Señor Jesús. Repetiremos esas palabras de cuando el Señor instituyó la Eucaristía, estas palabras que escuchamos con atención tienen mucha mas importancia de lo que pensamos se podría decir que es el epicentro de este terremoto en el que Dios entra en el mundo porque ahí se culmina ese plan que está en el corazón del Señor que ha hecho todo por venir a nosotros».
Destacaba el prelado gaditano en el sentido de la Eucaristía con palabras de Santo Tomas de Aquino. «Decía que en el misterio de la Eucaristía se contienen todas las riquezas que Dios ha querido dar al mundo. El pan que nos une es signo de nuestra comunidad. El Señor llama a la unidad en la fe, esperanza, caridad y amor». También ha querido Zornoza agradecer la labor de todos los que hacen posible esta procesión en esta jornada. «Os agradezco el esfuerzo, los preparativos, a los sacerdotes, a las parroquias... Muchas gracias por estar aquí porque vuestra presencia será un signo de ese deseo de caminar juntos que Dios tiene para nosotros para buscar el bien de todos. La procesión es una costumbre Cristiana. Nos permite aceptar la presencia de Dios en el mundo, en un mundo que se seculariza, que quiere vivir como si Dios no existiera. Se hace presente entre nosotros en nuestro mundo, nuestras calles... queriendo visitar a todos y socorrer sobre todo a los desvalidos, a los que están solos o los sin techo».
Tras la comunión se formaba el amplio cortejo de la procesión que empezaba a salir por la puerta principal de la Catedral. Abría camino la banda Ecce Mater de Cádiz y detrás, la cruz de guía cedida por la hermandad de Afligidos y los niños de Primera Comunión, los fieles, asociaciones de colegios católicos y las hermandades. Tras las imágenes del Niño Jesús, el beato Diego y los patronos iba la Alcaldesa Perpetua de Cádiz. La cuadrilla de cargadores de la archicofradía del Rosario elevaba el paso de la Patrona dentro de Catedral y caminaba hacia la salida. Mientras, dentro, bajo el palio de respeto llegaba el Santísimo Sacramento a la Custodia y era canónigo Guillermo Domínguez Leonsegui quien lo entronizaba en esa custodia del Cogollo que va dentro de la de plata.
Bajaba por la rampa dispuesta para este Corpus en Catedral el paso de la Patrona y sonaba la marcha Pasan los Campanilleros de López Farfán interpretada por la banda Maestro Dueñas de El Puerto. Unos minutos despúes con el persistente viento de levante sonaban de nuevo las campanas del primer templo de la diócesis y salía la Custodia con Jesús Sacramentado para llegar a todos los gaditanos. Se escuchaba entonces la marcha Corpus Christi que tocaba la banda de Música Cruz Roja ACM Maestro Agripino Lozano. José Julio Reyeros dirigía una vez más el carro de la Custodia flanqueado por sacerdotes. Detrás del Santísimo Sacramento, además de la curia, iba la corporación municipal con el alcalde, Bruno García, como máximo representante, y autoridades militares y civiles.
La procesión seguía el recorrido previsto, más arropada de público conforme avanzaba la mañana y se encaraban calles algo más protegidas del viento. Tras superar la Plaza de san Agustín llegaba hasta San Juan de Dios engalanada con mimo y donde se encontraba la alfombra de arena tintada que resistía a pesar del levante. Allí también se encontraba el altar que por primera vez había montado la hermandad del Rocío de Cádiz y que, junto a los demás altares preparados este año ensalzaban la fiesta.
Pasada la una de la tarde ya llegaba de nuevo el Santísimo Sacramento a la Catedral y repicaban las campanas. Allí el obispo procedía a la bendición final. Tras ello regresaban a su templo las imágenes para terminar esta jornada de un Corpus en Cádiz que ha ganado en solemnidad.

author: Алек Б. Петровски
title: Pistorius: Ukraine is just the beginning for Putin, Russia is arming itself for more than "just a war with Ukraine" - Free Press
text: Pistorius: Ukraine is just the beginning for Putin, Russia is arming for more than "just a war with Ukraine" German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius warned today that Russia is rapidly arming itself for more than the war in Ukraine, writes DPA. "We see that Russia is rapidly increasing its weapons production and dramatically strengthening its armed forces. All this removes the doubt: for Russia, for Vladimir Putin's Russia, Ukraine is just the beginning," Pistorius said in Vilnius. He emphasized that the German Bundeswehr is ready "to become the central pillar of conventional deterrence and defense in Europe." In this context, he emphasized the role of Germany as a center for the rapid transfer of NATO forces from the Atlantic to the eastern flank. Under the agreement with Lithuania, the German government permanently stationed a combat and autonomous brigade of the Bundeswehr in that country. That unit should be operational by 2027. The formation of the brigade is a response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine and reflects the changed picture of security in Europe. The German brigade will have up to 5.000 soldiers. Initially, they will be temporarily located at the Lithuanian barracks near Vilnius, and then at their own bases in Rudnikaya and Rukla, about thirty kilometers south and eighty kilometers northwest of Vilnius.

author: tbranna@rodmanmedia.com (Tom Branna)
title: P&G\'s Native Personal Care Formulas Boast Girl Scout Cookie Scents
text: 12.28.23 Native, the "clean" personal care brand "At Native, we pride ourselves on delighting our consumers with something unexpected yet craveable,” said Vineet Kumar, CEO of Native. “We are so excited to partner with Girl Scouts to transform its iconic cookie flavors into scents for our clean, simple and effective collection of products.” The new products are inspired by some of the most popular Girl Scout cookie flavors: Caramel Coconut - This oh-so-sweet scent of caramel, coconut and chocolate cookies is a true delight, according to Trefoils - Inspired by the original Girl Scout cookie recipe, this shortbread scent blends notes of vanilla, lemon and buttercream. Available in deodorant and body wash. Peanut Butter - A medley of peanut butter, vanilla and brown sugar scents. Available in deodorant and body wash. Lemon -This refreshing shortbread scent melds with tangy lemon to create a delicious mix. Available in deodorant and deodorant & body spray. Thin Mints - A vibrant blend of mint and chocolate scents to refresh your senses. Available in body wash, shampoo, conditioner and 2-in-1 shampoo and conditioner. “Seeing our cookies inspire an entire line of personal care products is really exciting,” said Wendy Lou, chief revenue officer at GSUSA. “These products are a fun twist on ways folks can enjoy the scents of our beloved cookie flavors.” Regular, sensitive and plastic free deodorants retail for $13, Deodorant & body spray retail for $14, Body wash retails for $9, 2-in-1 shampoo & conditioner retails for $10 and shampoo & conditioner will each retail for $10. The collection launches exclusively on Native’s [owned](https://www.happi.com/contents/view_breaking-news/2017-11-15/pg-buys-natural-deodorant-start-up/)by [Procter & Gamble](https://www.happi.com/heaps/view/11582/1/485385), launched a limited-edition collection, inspired by some of the most popular [Girl Scout Cookies](http://www.girlscouts.org). The collection includes deodorant, deodorant & body spray, body wash, shampoo and conditioner in a variety of cookie-inspired scents. "At Native, we pride ourselves on delighting our consumers with something unexpected yet craveable,” said Vineet Kumar, CEO of Native. “We are so excited to partner with Girl Scouts to transform its iconic cookie flavors into scents for our clean, simple and effective collection of products.” The new products are inspired by some of the most popular Girl Scout cookie flavors: Caramel Coconut - This oh-so-sweet scent of caramel, coconut and chocolate cookies is a true delight, according to [Native](https://www.happi.com/issues/2022-11-01/view_features/sustainability-natural-ingredients-drive-deodorant-formulation-for-2022/). Available in deodorant, deodorant & body spray, sensitive deodorant, plastic free deodorant, body wash, shampoo and conditioner. Trefoils - Inspired by the original Girl Scout cookie recipe, this shortbread scent blends notes of vanilla, lemon and buttercream. Available in deodorant and body wash. Peanut Butter - A medley of peanut butter, vanilla and brown sugar scents. Available in deodorant and body wash. Lemon -This refreshing shortbread scent melds with tangy lemon to create a delicious mix. Available in deodorant and deodorant & body spray. Thin Mints - A vibrant blend of mint and chocolate scents to refresh your senses. Available in body wash, shampoo, conditioner and 2-in-1 shampoo and conditioner. “Seeing our cookies inspire an entire line of personal care products is really exciting,” said Wendy Lou, chief revenue officer at GSUSA. “These products are a fun twist on ways folks can enjoy the scents of our beloved cookie flavors.” Regular, sensitive and plastic free deodorants retail for $13, Deodorant & body spray retail for $14, Body wash retails for $9, 2-in-1 shampoo & conditioner retails for $10 and shampoo & conditioner will each retail for $10. author: NewsBreak Original
title: 1 dead, 2 in critical condition in Boyle Heights house fire
text:
One person was killed and two were hospitalized in critical condition Thursday after they were found inside a burning one-story home in Boyle Heights. Fire crews responded at 4:24 a.m. to 742 S. St Louis St. and Boyle Avenue, east of the (5) Freeway. where they found the residence consumed with flames, said Los Angeles Fire Department spokeswoman Margaret Stewart. One of the residence's occupants was found outside on the porch and pronounced dead at the scene, Stewart said. During a search of the building, firefighters located two victims and pulled them out in critical condition. Paramedics took them to a hospital, Stewart added. Two other residents of the home were outside when firefighters arrived and were evaluated for any injuries. A total of 54 firefighters were able to contain and extinguish the fire in 25 minutes. As is the department's protocol, LAFD's Arson Investigation Section will be in charge of investigating the cause of the fire. Follow KNX News 97.1 FM
